intro: Hieracium pseudellipticum, commonly known as the false hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer. Hieracium pseudellipticum is an annual or biennial plant, depending on the region, and is often found in open habitats with well-drained soil.
